results.title: Renegade
results.brief_description: As Agent Renegade it is your mission to save the world from destruction by the alien monsters. This is a fast-paced action-packed game that plays on your reflexes and hand/eye co-ordination.

results.title: Telephone technique
results.creator_credit: Wesley Greene, Crawley Films and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Part of a series on sales training, this episode deals with telephone training for retail sales clerks. It emphasizes good telephone manners, wide knowledge of stock, importance of correct customer name and address and the necessity for an intelligent descriptive vocabulary when speaking of merchandise over the telephone.

results.title: Bushland fantasy
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Soundmasters
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the many wild flowers and animals found in the Australian bush. Includes photographs of native flora, and animal life such as kangaroos, wallabies, platypus, lyrebirds and koalas. Many of these can be found in the wildlife sanctuary at Healesville where special efforts are made to arrange a proper diet for these animals. Narrated by John Dudley.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A survey of the use of gas in commercial cooking and industrial establishments. The film includes glimpses of what happens “behind the menu” at establishments like the Menzies Hotel, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, the canteen at General Motors and a biscuit factory.

results.title: Here's your bike, Ed!
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, John Taylor, Taylormade Films and Vic Roads
results.brief_description: The purpose of this title is to demonstrate a variety of skills that children need to cycle safely on roads. Designed to accompany a Bike Ed program in schools, with Teacher’s notes, there are a variety of activities and drills which will develop children’s confidence as bike riders and users of the road.

results.title: Timber
results.brief_description: A survey of the forests from which Australia obtains timber supplies for firewood, building and other industrial purposes. Illustrates tree-felling and the various methods used to transport logs to timber-mills. Overviews the preservation of natural forests and revegetation programs.

results.title: The Greatest Art Movement: Transporting Art: the Story of Melbourne's Art Trams
results.creator_credit: Michael Buckley, Arts Victoria and National Heart Foundation of Australia. Victorian Division
results.brief_description: Trams have always been a feature of Melbourne life and they have now been transformed into moving art galleries. Melbourne’s Transporting Art Project involves a new series of decorated trams. Several of the artists discuss their reasons for taking part in the scheme, the themes behind their work and the unusual medium. Artists include Aleks Danko, Philip Faulks, Lin Onus, Terry Matassoni, Jenny Watson and Brett Colquhoun.
results.title_for_label: The Greatest Art Movement: Transporting Art: the Story of Melbourne’s Art Trams
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Buckley, Arts Victoria and National Heart Foundation of Australia. Victorian Division

results.title: Whole School Planning
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studies in effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have improved their effectiveness. The first episode, “Whole school planning” looks at planning as a manageable series of arrangements designed to involve all interested parties and to make the best use of limited resources. Deer Park Secondary College features in this case study.

results.title: Women of the iron frontier
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video
results.brief_description: Filmed in the remote Pilbara region in far north Western Australia this is a moving revelation of the struggle of women who are trying to create a life for themselves in the hostile environment of outback iron ore mining towns. “Time goes very slowly” deals with the problems of isolation and unemployment for women in Newman. “It’s not a community anymore” tells of the ongoing effects of the bitter 1986 Robe River industrial dispute upon families in the town of Wickham. “It’s supposed to be a town” explores racism through the eyes of both the black and white women of Newman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video
